name: Grand Hotel Europa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location was great. Easy access to all the sites and ski areas.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: Customer service was great, very helpful staff.
reviews.title: First class stay at a first class Hotel

reviews.text: Only downside was the breakfast, the fresh fruit sometimes smelt (like when you leave it out for too long). But the pastries were good :-)
reviews.title: Exceptional!

reviews.text: Words cannot express how impressed I was with the Hotel and it's staff. Everything was first rate. We were treated the best we've ever been treated in Europe by Roman and his staff. Wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.
reviews.title: I had a wonderful weekend here

reviews.text: To start off, the location couldn´t have been better. Customer service was exceptional, the staff starting from Front Desk to waitresses at the breakfast buffet, was eager to help and make life easy every single moment of our stay.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel and so much more!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: Last week we went to the spring fashion show 2013 held in the fabulous Baroque Hall. We were delighted by the enthusiasm of the staff, the fun show (although not completely my style of clothes), the great drinks and the delicious finger food! What a place to organize your event, thank you Europa Hotel team for a pleasant night.
reviews.title: Fun, exciting evening with great food!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Grand Hotel Europa. Unfortunately my husband broke his ankle. The hotel could not do more to assist us with getting to the hospital, extending our stay, enquiring about his health and asking if they could assist me. The hotel is very well decorated, exceptionally clean and in a good location with convenient parking. The breakfast is great.
reviews.title: Fabulous Service

reviews.text: My wife and I recently stayed at the Europa with our one year old. We were impressed right away with how clean and modern the hotel is and were very surprised to see how large our standard room turned out to be. It was easily the largest hotel room in Europe we've ever had. It was about a ten to fifteen minute walk to the main downtown area and directly across the street from the main train station which houses a really nice grocery store downstairs (MPreis I think it was called). The front desk staff was very helpful in giving us directions and suggesting things to do. Overall it made a great home base for exploring Innsbruck and we really enjoyed staying here. The only downside was the confusing light switches. There are buttons labeled 1-4 and even after staying there for 3 days I still couldn't entirely figure out what each button turned on or off. There was a large lamp in the room that was supposed to be the main light except it had no switch on it and none of the buttons turned it on, so we had to do with "accent lighting" the entire stay.
reviews.title: Location, Cleanliness, and Space

reviews.text: Had the pleasure of staying at Grand Hotel Europa for one night on our return from ski holiday. Our party consisted of four adults and six children. The staff were fantastic, rooms well presented and spotless and food superb. We ate in the hotels restaurant which was fantastic and certainly best food of our holiday. The children were treated like royality and were thrilled to be invited to choose a lovely chocolate truffle each at the end of the meal. The selection of breads were fantastic, appitizers mouth watering and my lobster main in particular was delectable. Would like to especially thank Amitab, Ibraham and Kohlalr in the restaurant who ensured that our dining experience was perfect they were so lovely with children. Breakfast the following morning was equally as good and could not be faulted. The hotel manager, Roman, is obviously passionate about hospitality and you can sense that guest satisfaction is the number one priority. I can't wait to return - thank you so much for providing a perfect end to our family ski trip.
reviews.title: Faultless - simply superb

reviews.text: The Grand Hotel Europa and its restaurant was a delightful experience! The staff provided an excellent service and the dinner experience in the restaurant was unique, I would like to return soon! Compliments to the management!
reviews.title: Great style and class!

reviews.text: I picked this hotel due to the generally favourable reviews on TripAdvisor and also due to the recommendation from the Frommer's Guide. The location is unbeatable - just opposite the train station and about 8 to 10 minutes leisurely walk to the old town center.
reviews.title: Rustic and charming hotel, but needs some modernization

reviews.text: I got a junior suite, which was spacious with a separate living room area and bedroom. The decor was rather "dated", with a generous dose of alpine wood furniture and ceilings. I am personally not a huge fan of too much "wood" in my room, so I felt a bit uncomfortable. The carpet looked old, despite the fact that my room was in an apparently newer part of the hotel.
reviews.title: Character and style in abundance

reviews.text: The bed was alright, though not very firm. The bathroom was bright, white (which I like) and clean.
reviews.title: great place in a great city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was quite good with sufficient variety. The hotel restaurant is reputed to be one of the best in town, but be prepared for an expensive meal.
reviews.title: brilliant

reviews.text: Overall, I was not very impressed with this hotel. However, this being the first time I stayed in Innsbruck, I could not compare with other hotels in the city.
reviews.title: Top hotel for ski breaks

reviews.text: For a business meeting we stayed at the hotel. It is located directly at the train station and very close to the pedestrian zone with clubs and sights. Food in the restaurant "Europastüberl" is excellent. Also the rooms and the whole style of the hotel are a great combination of modern and traditional design. Very friendly and helpful service.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel - great rooms, food and value

reviews.text: We spent eight days here while skiing the surrounding resorts. From the two porters who met our train and escorted us back onto the train when we left, the entire staff was superb. Each night when we'd return from from Old Town ( a short lovely walk away) the front desk staff would greet us as though they had been watching out for us to make sure we were in. We stayed in a traditional Jr. Suite and loved it although it was darker than their modern rooms. Typical of their attentive service, they offered to bring in another floor lamp if we liked.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel in a perfect location!

reviews.text: If you don't leave here thinking of general manager Roman Straub as an old friend, you are way, way too hard to please.
reviews.title: Great location for train travellers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice hotel with excellent service and great cuisine.
reviews.title: comfortable stay- great food !

reviews.text: Located directly at the train station and in walking distance to the old town, great for shopping and sightseeing. The rooms are quite despite vicinity to the train station.
reviews.title: Five travelers delighted with this Five Star hotel

description: The Grand Hotel Europa is a top hotel in Innsbruck, Austria, and one of the most impressive hotels in central Europe. The hotel’s location makes it perfect for exploring Innsbruck, and the beautiful surrounding countryside. The location, modern amenities and stunning decor make the hotel highly regarded.
